message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including fatigue, dizziness, weight loss, and hypotension suggest adrenal insufficiency. The presence of hyperpigmentation suggests primary adrenal insufficiency, which is caused by autoimmune destruction of the adrenal gland. Option B describes secondary adrenal insufficiency caused by pituitary dysfunction. Option C describes tertiary adrenal insufficiency caused by hypothalamic dysfunction. We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings suggest adrenal insufficiency, and among the options, only autoimmune destruction of the adrenal gland (also known as Addison's disease) can cause these symptoms. Low adrenocorticotropic hormone secretion from the pituitary gland or low corticotropin-releasing hormone secretion from the hypothalamus can also cause adrenal insufficiency, but they would not lead to thyroid and skin findings. Increased iron absorption and deposition in the body is associated with hemochromatosis, which would not explain the patient's symptoms.
